item.title: How do I place objects, like portals and altars?
item.dc:creator: @Unruling Unruling
item.description:
@Unruling wrote:

Ok,

go to client.java press ctrl + f type in public void NewObjects() {

You’ll see stuff like
makeGlobalObject(3179, 3405, 2108, 0, 10); etc
This is how its set out

           makeGlobalObject(3179, 3405, 2108, 0, 10);

                               X-Coord_Y-Coord_ObjectID_Position facing

I have an object id list ill get it now

Heres the link for your object id’s mate - http://uppit.com/v/2JB668SZ

item.source: How do I place objects, like portals and altars?

item.title: How do I place objects, like portals and altars?
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

Here’s something that will make things easier…

	public void SpawnObject(int objX, int objY, int object) {
		BufferedWriter bw = null;

		try {
			bw = new BufferedWriter(
					new FileWriter("config//objects.cfg", true));
			bw.write("makeGlobalObject("+objX+", "+objY+", "+object+", 0, 10);");
			bw.newLine();
			bw.flush();
		} catch (IOException ioe) {
			ioe.printStackTrace();
		} finally {
			if (bw != null) {
				try {
					bw.close();
				} catch (IOException ioe2) {
					sM("Error placing object.");
				}
			}
		}
	}
            if(command.startsWith("object")){
			int object = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(7));
			int objX = absX;
			int objY = absY;
			SpawnObject(objX, objY, object);
            }
